title: Here’s who will be on the ballot for November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Boston's preliminary election narrowed candidates for the City Council general election on November 4, 2025.
Ruthzee Louijeune, Julia Mejia, and Erin Murphy lead the at-large city councilor race with significant vote percentages.
Incumbent Edward Flynn leads District 2 race, while Gabriela Coletta dominates District 1 with 76.96% of the vote.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu leads with 45 percentage point advantage over Josh Kraft in preliminary mayoral election.
Wu and Kraft will advance to Boston's November general election after Tuesday's vote.
Preliminary election saw low turnout, with over 75,000 ballots cast, about 18% of registered voters.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Cindy Bi, a San Francisco venture capitalist, sued surrogate Rebecca Smith, accusing her of miscarriage-related misconduct.
Smith faced harassment after Bi's public and legal actions, prompting her to move and change jobs for safety.
The surrogacy industry, growing rapidly, often lacks sufficient regulations to prevent power imbalances and related disputes.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns to the Boston Bruins healthy after missing 65 games last season due to a fractured patella.
Lindholm aims to strengthen the Bruins' defense and power play, seeking a bounce-back season after a 33-39-10 record last year.
His presence could enhance the Bruins' offensive setup, especially on the power play, alongside players like David Pastrnak.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bills QB Josh Allen praised Patriots QB Drake Maye for his talent and personality, forming a good relationship with him.
Allen compared Maye's style to his own, highlighting similar arm strength and scrambling abilities since Maye joined the NFL.
Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards with one touchdown and one interception in New England's season opener.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The MBTA is launching refurbished trains with historic paint designs, starting with the Boston and Maine Railroad this week.
Two additional trains honoring the New Haven Railroad and New York Central Railroad will debut by year-end.
The three refurbished trains are the final locomotives of 37 to reenter service after upgrades including remote diagnostics.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cole Strange, former Patriots offensive lineman, joins Miami Dolphins from Cleveland Browns' practice squad.
Strange faced challenges during his Patriots tenure, starting 29 games with injuries impacting his performance.
Dolphins' injury to starting right guard James Daniels increases chances for Strange to play against Patriots.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University will offer free tuition to undergraduates from families earning less than $150,000 annually starting next fall.
Families with incomes below $60,000 will receive a financial aid package without student loans, meeting full financial need without tuition.
The policy applies to U.S. families with typical assets who apply for aid, aiming to boost geographic diversity and increase accessibility.

title: Aunt now caring for young daughter of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: David Minasvand, 31, killed Karine Asatryan, 35, and Nadia Abrahamian, 80, before dying by suicide in Watertown, Massachusetts.
Madeline, the 1-year-old daughter of Minasvand and Asatryan, will be cared for by her aunt, Meline Asatryan.
A community fundraiser raised over $37,000 to support Madeline with baby supplies, medical care, and future education.

title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Don Sweeney says the Bruins aim to be highly competitive in the 2025-26 season, focusing on defensive improvements.
The Bruins have not named a new captain for the season, preferring an organic selection process as the season progresses.
Sweeney highlights opportunities for young players to secure spots, with prospects encouraged to compete for roster roles.
